concept.title: Getting Set Up with AWS Command Line Interface

conbody.p: Before you can start using the AWS Command Line Interface, you must sign up for an AWS account (if you don't already have one) and set up you CLI environment. Depending on your operating system and environment, there are different ways to install the AWS CLI:
The following sections will help you decide which option to use.

p.note: The AWS CLI makes API calls to services over HTTPS. Outblound connections on TCP port 443 must be enabled in order to perform calls.
